cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.algorithm
Interface Algorithm

All Known Subinterfaces:
ChainAlgorithm
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseAlgorithm, BreadthFirstSearch, DepthFirstSearch, GeneticAlgorithm, GraphSearch, SimulatedAnnealing
public interface Algorithm

Common interface for all algorithms.

Defines basic operations all algorithms must implement in order to be able to be used in JCOP.

See Also:
Base abstract implementation, reducing work required to add new algorithm

Method Detail

init

void init(ObjectiveProblem problem)
          throws InvalidProblemException
Initializes new Algorithm on a problem.

Algorithm is expected to prepare its fitness at this point, since solver can override it afterwards.

Also, keep in mind that one algorithm could be used repeatedly on several different problems, so init should reset all local settings.

Parameters:
problem - problem to be initialized on
Throws:
InvalidProblemException - if supplied problem cannot be solved by this algorithm

optimize

void optimize()
              throws CannotContinueException
Performs one optimization step.

Throws:
CannotContinueException - if no more optimization steps are possible

getBestConfiguration

Configuration getBestConfiguration()
Returns best found configuration.

Returns:
best found configuration

cleanUp

void cleanUp()
Performs clean up after algorithm stopped.

setFitness

void setFitness(Fitness fitness)
Updates which fitness to use instead of default. Should be called before first optimize step is made.

Parameters:
fitness - fitness to be used in algorithm

getBestFitness

double getBestFitness()
Returns fitness of best found configuration.

Returns:
fitness of best found configuration

setLabel

void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
Sets label for algorithm.

Note that label is important because ResultEntry uses it to distinguish between different settings of same algorithm.

This should be called automatically in constructor (and no later than in init(cz.cvut.felk.cig.jcop.problem.ObjectiveProblem), because Solver might need to override it.

Parameters:
label - new label for algorithm

getLabel

java.lang.String getLabel()
Gets label of algorithm.

For more info, see setLabel(String).

Returns:
label for algorithm
